sentences.english: They are talking out of turn, they are throwing paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们口无遮拦，把纸张扔得满天飞。

sentences.english: In the day, I see the snow, yellow and green in the white.
sentences.chinese: 白昼，白雪满天飞，散在黄枝绿蕾。

sentences.english: In the center of the dusty city lies the famous Djemaa el Fna Square.
sentences.chinese: 在灰尘满天飞的城中央，则是著名的德吉玛广场。

sentences.english: Scratch the subject of defence and acronym abbreviation and buzzwords fly out.
sentences.chinese: 话题触及国防，缩合字，缩写字和行话就满天飞。

sentences.english: Rumor is everywhere, people are easy to believe it without testifying.
sentences.chinese: 谣言满天飞，人们很容易相信即使没有证据。

sentences.english: There s dirt on the affair between Jessica abd the manager.
sentences.chinese: 关于杰西卡和经理之间的风流韵事，流言满天飞。

sentences.english: Predictions like this flew at the summit.
sentences.chinese: 在这次峰会上，类似的预言满天飞。

definition: lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
hard to distinguish real from imitation
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
